Definition: Simulants in 2020
Simulants in 2021
Simulants in 2022
Simulants in 2023
Simulants in 2024
Simulants aged 0-7 days
Simulants aged 7-28 days
Simulants aged 28-365 days
Simulants aged 1-4 years
Male simulants
Female simulants
Simulant's Hb level will respond to iron fortification (see Iron Deficiency cause model documentation)
Notes: Only needed to verify Iron Deficiency  component and iron intervention effect on Hb

Definition: Simulant's Hb level will not respond to iron fortification (see Iron Deficiency cause model documentation)
Notes: Only needed to verify Iron Deficiency  component and iron intervention effect on Hb

Definition: Simulant is not receiving vitamin A fortification
Notes: Used for verifying effect of vitamin A fortification on vitamin A deficiency

Definition: Simulant is receiving vitamin A fortification, but it is not affecting their probability of being vitamin A deficient (because either the time since fortification is less than the simulant's vitamin A response time, or the simulant is under 6mo old)
Notes: Called "covered" in current output, but that terminology is confusing

Definition: Simulant is receiving vitamin A fortification and it is affecting their probability of being vitamin A deficient (time since fortification is greater than the individual's vitamin A response time, and the simulant is at least 6mo old)
Notes: Called "effectively covered" in current output, but that terminology is confusing

Definition: Simulant born prior to start of simulation, hence mother's folic acid fortification status is unknown
Notes: Used for verifying folic acid effect on neural tube defects

Definition: Simulant's mother did not receive sufficient folic acid fortification before and during pregnancy
Notes: Used for verifying folic acid effect on neural tube defects

Definition: Simulant's mother received sufficient folic acid fortification before and during pregnancy (fortification started at least one year prior to giving birth)
Notes: Used for verifying folic acid effect on neural tube defects

Definition: Simulant born prior to start of simulation, hence mother's iron fortification status is unknown
Notes: Used for verifying iron effect on birthweight

Definition: Simulant's mother did not receive sufficient iron fortification while pregnant
Notes: Used for verifying iron effect on birthweight

Definition: Simulant's mother received sufficient iron fortification while pregnant (fortification started before 20 weeks of gestation and lasted for at least 7 weeks)
Notes: Used for verifying iron effect on birthweight

Definition: Simulant is not eating iron-fortified food (household is not receiving iron-fortified food, or simulant is under 6mo old and not eating solids)
Notes: Used for verifying iron effect on Hb

Definition: Simulant is eating iron-fortified food (household is receiving fortified food, and simulant is at least 6mo old and hence eating solids)
Notes:
Used for verifying iron effect on Hb

Note: The simulant may not be receiving the full effect of iron fortification even if they are eating iron-fortified food, because 1) Due to childrens' assumed food consumption pattern, the full effect is only seen starting at 2 years of age, and 2) There is a time lag of 6 months to get the full age-dependent effect, even for simulants aged > 2 years
